name: Research Opportunity Program
description: This course provides a richly rewarding opportunity for students in their third year to work in the research project of a professor in return for POL399Y course credit. Students enrolled have an opportunity to become involved in original research, learn research methods and share in the excitement and discovery of acquiring new knowledge. Participating faculty members post their project descriptions for the following summer and fall/winter sessions in early February and students are invited to apply in early March. SeeÿExperiential and International Opportunitiesÿfor more details.
exclusions: adding 0.5 credit 300 level ROP option to enhance experiential learning offerings for students (now permitted by Dean's office)
